tiled.view
Class MapView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  tiled.view.MapView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HexMapView, IsoMapView, OrthoMapView, ShiftedMapView
public abstract class MapView
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.Scrollable

The base class for map views. This is meant to be extended for different tile map orientations, such as orthagonal and isometric.

Version:
$Id$
See Also:
Serialized Form

createViewforMap

public static MapView createViewforMap(Map p)
Creates a MapView instance that will render the map in the right orientation.

Parameters:
p - the Map to create a view for
Returns:
a suitable instance of a MapView for the given Map
See Also:
Map.getOrientation()

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws all the visible layers of the map. Takes several flags into account when drawing, and will also draw the grid, and any 'special' layers.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - the Graphics2D object to paint to
See Also:
JComponent.paintComponent(Graphics), MapLayer, SelectionLayer

repaintRegion

public void repaintRegion(java.awt.Rectangle region)
Tells this view a certain region of the map needs to be repainted.

Same as calling repaint() unless implemented more efficiently in a subclass.

Parameters:
region - the region that has changed in tile coordinates

screenToPixelCoords

public abstract java.awt.Point screenToPixelCoords(int x,
                                                   int y)
Returns the pixel coordinates on the map based on the given screen coordinates. The map pixel coordinates may be different in more ways than the zoom level, depending on the projection the view implements.

Parameters:
x - x in screen coordinates
y - y in screen coordinates
Returns:
the position in map pixel coordinates
